intro: Urostigma fraseri, commonly known as the Fraser's bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pungent odor, typical of the mustard family. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Urostigma fraseri is an annual herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing several seeds.
